8080.description: Port for scrutiny's web interface and API.
8080.label: WebUI HTTP port

/config.description: Choose a Share for Scrutiny config files. Eg: create a Share called Scrutiny-Share-Config for this purpose alone.
/config.label: Config share

PUID.description: Enter a valid system UserID for Scrutiny. Must have full permissions on the previous Share.
PUID.label: UID

PGID.description: Enter a valid system GroupID for Scrutiny. This group or the above UserID must have full permissions on the previous Share.
PGID.label: GID

SCRUTINY_API_ENDPOINT.description: API endpoint of the scrutiny UI. Do not change unless using as a remote collector. Default: 'http://localhost:8080'
SCRUTINY_API_ENDPOINT.label: SCRUTINY_API_ENDPOINT

Scrutiny.description:
WebUI for smartd S.M.A.R.T monitoring. Scrutiny is a Hard Drive Health Dashboard & Monitoring solution, merging manufacturer provided S.M.A.R.T metrics with real-world failure rates from Backblaze.

Based on custom docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/linuxserver/scrutiny, available for x86-64, arm64, and armhf
Scrutiny.more_info:
Note:This image is updating the stats only once a day, if you see: 'No Devices Detected!' after the installation, just wait 24 hours.
This process can also be triggered manually from the shell by executing the following command: docker exec scrutiny scrutiny-collector-metrics run
More documentation on this can be found here: Scrutiny GitHub
